text.script:
# variable names and values # if multiple variables, the number of values to test should be the same variable_values = {'n':[1,2,3], 'k':[4,5,6]}
# random variables r = random.randrange(3,6,1)
# Solutions with variables converted to string # Make sure you name the solution with part id at the end. e.g. 'solution1' will be solution for part 1. solution1 = "(26^n)-(25^n)+{0}".format(r) solution2 = "8" solution3 = "35*k"
# Group all solutions into a list solutions = [solution1, solution2, solution3]

ul.li: How many strings of length $n consisting of lower case English letters, and including at least one "x", are there?
Part 3, fill in your answer here.
